Class Game

java.lang.Object
src.tddgame.Game
public class Game extends Object
The Game class handles core game logic and manages the grid. It can either use a provided grid or generate a random one.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game(int size)
    Constructs a game with a randomly generated grid of the given size.
    Game(Grid grid)
    Constructs a game using an existing grid.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(Grid grid)
      Constructs a game using an existing grid.
      Parameters:
      grid - the grid to be used in the game

    • Game

      public Game(int size)
      Constructs a game with a randomly generated grid of the given size.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the square grid (must be between 3 and 7)

  • Method Details

    • getGrid

      public Grid getGrid()
      Returns the current grid.
      Returns:
      the current grid

    • setGrid

      public void setGrid(Grid grid)
      Updates the game grid.
      Parameters:
      grid - the new grid to use

    • play

      public boolean play(Movement direction, Player player)
      Attempts to move the player in a given direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to move in
      player - the player to move
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false otherwise

    • createRandomGrid

      public Grid createRandomGrid(int size)
      Generates a random grid with a path from the bottom-right to the top-left. The top-left cell will have an EXIT component.
      Parameters:
      size - the desired size of the grid (between 3 and 7)
      Returns:
      a randomized Grid object or null if size is invalid

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the game (mostly for debugging).
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing the game and its grid
